NHEFS Dataset

Source: R/data.R
nhefs.Rd

A subset of data from the National Health and Nutrition Examination Follow-up Study (NHEFS).

Usage

nhefs

Format

nhefs

A data frame with 1,629 rows and 64 columns:

seqn

Sequence number (unique identifier for each participant)

qsmk

Smoking cessation status (0 = continued smoking, 1 = quit smoking)

death

Death status (0 = alive, 1 = deceased)

yrdth

Year of death

modth

Month of death

dadth

Day of death

sbp

Systolic blood pressure (mmHg)

dbp

Diastolic blood pressure (mmHg)

sex

Gender (0 = male, 1 = female)

age

Age in years at baseline

race

Race (1 = white, 2 = black, 3 = other)

income

Annual income in US dollars

education

Years of education

wt71

Weight in 1971 (lbs)

wt82

Weight in 1982 (lbs)

wt82_71

Weight change from 1971 to 1982 (lbs)

exercise

Frequency of exercise (1 = none, 2 = moderate, 3 = high)

active

Physical activity status

alcohol

Alcohol consumption status (0 = no, 1 = yes)

chol

Total cholesterol level (mg/dL)

smokeintensity

Number of cigarettes smoked per day

smokeyrs

Number of years smoked

ht

Height in inches

diabetes

Diabetes status (0 = no, 1 = yes)

marital

Marital status (1 = married, 2 = widowed, 3 = divorced/separated, 4 = never married)

mental

Mental health status score

physact

Physical activity level score

pef

Peak expiratory flow (L/min)

heart_disease

History of heart disease (0 = no, 1 = yes)

stroke

History of stroke (0 = no, 1 = yes)

cancer

History of cancer (0 = no, 1 = yes)

asthma

Asthma diagnosis (0 = no, 1 = yes)

bronchitis

Bronchitis diagnosis (0 = no, 1 = yes)

emphysema

Emphysema diagnosis (0 = no, 1 = yes)

hosp

Number of hospital visits

physvis

Number of physician visits

depress

Depression score

alcohol_freq

Frequency of alcohol consumption

diet_score

Diet quality score

vitamin_use

Vitamin supplement use (0 = no, 1 = yes)

medication_use

Medication usage status (0 = no, 1 = yes)

insurance

Health insurance coverage status (0 = no, 1 = yes)

Source

https://wwwn.cdc.gov/nchs/nhanes/nhefs/Default.aspx
